artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Author: Nozaki Bunzō; Publisher: Daikokuya Kinnosuke
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 134.19; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 24 no. 27, p. 288.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: old person with grey hair and wrinkled skin, kneeling and bending backwards, with hands on sides of face, wearing garments in green, blue, brown and dark green with yellow patterns; black box filled with demon figures at left, including a three-eyed figure with a wide mouth and two tentacles on either side of its nose, wearing a green and grey garment, a figure with an exaggerated face, with wide nose and mouth, holding its eyes and mouth open with its hands, and two blue demon figures
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From One Hundred Tales from Japan and China (Wakan hyaku monogatari 和漢百物語)
signed: 一魁斎芳年画 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi ga}
title: The Greedy Old Woman
